results.title: The Novo Castrian story: an impression of the Port of Newcastle, Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch and New South Wales. Maritime Services Board
results.brief_description: The port of Newcastle, N.S.W., its existing facilities and work on new wharf and reclamation developments. The life and major industries of the city and the Hunter Valley are shown briefly.

results.title: The Novel: early Victorian England and Charles Dickens
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines Victorian England, pointing out its startling contrasts of morality and hypocrisy, splendour and squalor, prosperity and poverty. Illustrates these points by enactments of episodes from Dickens’ novels.

results.title: The Novel and television
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The 19th Century Novel”.
A discussion on some of the differences between the novel in its television dramatised form and the original prose. The film uses the problems involved in dramatisation as a way of discussing the novels concerned. The novels dealt with are Cousin Bette and Great Expectations.

results.title: The Nose, throat and ears
results.brief_description: Describes the structure and functions of these organs. Shows that, although they are separate organs, they are all lined with a continuous mucous membrane and that infection in one may lead to infection in the others.

results.title: The Nose = Le Nez
results.creator_credit: Alexandre Alexeieff, Claire Parker and Cinema Nouveau
results.brief_description: Based on a story by Nicoli Gogol and drawn on pinboard, tells of a young man who unwittingly loses his nose at the barbers. After an unsuccessful and exhausting search, the nose is returned to him. Next morning he calls again at the barbers for a shave.

results.title: The Northern Territory
results.brief_description: A broad view of developments in the Territory, showing the wide range of mineral resources being exploited, the expansion of the cattle industry and new industries, and the improvement of transport.

results.title: The Northern run
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound
results.brief_description: The story of the Queensland Coast and Torres Strait Pilot Service told by four of the master mariners of the service. Each year the pilots take some 1500 overseas and coastal vessels through these hazardous but beautiful parts. Beneath the beauty of the Great Barrier Reef there are hazards; strong tidal streams, saw-toothed reefs, the skeletons of wrecked ships, and other menaces.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound

results.title: The North wind and the sun: an Aesop fable
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: Combining old world and modern elements, this colorful animated film tells the story of a contest between the north wind and the sun. “You can sometimes do more by being gentle than you can by using force” is the useful lesson children will gain from this film.
results.title_for_label: The North wind and the sun: an Aesop fable
